meanings.definition: To finish the edge of a fabric with a serger machine.
meanings.sent1: She carefully serged the hem of the dress to prevent fraying.
meanings.sent2: Mom serged the tablecloth to give it a neat and professional look.
meanings.sent3: The fabric was so excited to be serged by the machine, it felt like a spa day!
meanings.sent4: The serged edges of the curtains were like perfectly trimmed hedges in a garden.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, she serged the fabric, creating a clean and polished finish.

meanings.definition: Having been finished with a serger machine.
meanings.sent1: The serged edges of the napkins added a touch of elegance to the table setting.
meanings.sent2: The serged seams of the pillowcases ensured they would not unravel.
meanings.sent3: The serged blanket felt like a cozy hug from a fluffy cloud.
meanings.sent4: Her serged scarf was a seamless blend of style and functionality.
meanings.sent5: The serged edges of the quilt were like the frame of a beautiful artwork.
